text:
You read the final entry: 'The mirror does not reflect — it remembers.'

The wind stops. The world narrows. At the ruin’s edge stands a cracked mirror, bound in roots and boundless dread.

As you approach, your reflection falters, twisting into shapes of moments you never lived — or buried long ago.

Behind the glass, something watches. It does not mimic. It judges.
lore: The Mirror of Binding is said to trap the echoes of those who could not bear their truth. It does not lie. It reveals. But not all can survive revelation.
